info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:03PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Whiteside County through 700 PM CDT... At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Ustick to Morrison and Lyndon, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morrison, Prophetstown, Lyndon, Union Grove, Ustick, Round Grove, Prophetstown State Recreation Area, Hamilton Corners, Unionville, Morrison-Rockwood State Park and Whiteside County Fairgrounds. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 25 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
